EmailTemplate.subject: Going to Hadoop Summit? Here’s How to Laugh and Learn
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
Headed to Hadoop Summit? Be sure to visit booth #1607. We’ll be illustrating how great software companies use Hadoop and Pivotal’s portfolio of open data management technologies <[[http://pivotal.io/big-data/pivotal-big-data-suite]]> to develop smart, data-driven applications that deliver information in context. Get all your Big Data questions answered and check out a full stack demo by a Pivotal data expert. Snag some swag, too. The Women in Big Data <[[http://hadoopsummit.org/san-jose/special-events/]]>
Hadoop Summit will be hosting a lunch and panel discussion on Tuesday, June 28th, 1–2pm. The panelists—including our own Cornelia Davis, Sr. Director of Technology—will share their challenges, experiences, and points of view. Please join us <[[http://hadoopsummit.org/san-jose/special-events/]]>. Win Tickets to a Show <[[https://www.eventbrite.com/e/night-of-the-living-data-tickets-25146988319]]>
Pivotal is proud to sponsor Night of the Living Data <[[https://www.eventbrite.com/e/night-of-the-living-data-tickets-25146988319]]>, a night of original sketch comedy by San Francisco’s premiere comedy troupe, Killing My Lobster. The show is at 8pm on Tuesday the 28th. Stop by booth #1607 earlier that day for a chance to win tickets. Proceeds go to Girls Who Code <[[https://girlswhocode.com/]]>. Learn more about Pivotal’s involvement with Girls Who Code <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/tag/girls-who-code]]>. <[[http://live.siliconangle.tv/]]> ODPi Meetup <[[http://www.meetup.com/Open-Data-Platform-Group/events/231569465/]]>
ODPi <[[https://www.odpi.org/]]> is holding a meetup on Monday, June 27th at 6pm. Speakers will discuss the challenges associated with developing software compatible with multiple Hadoop distributions and why they feel ODPi will help simplify this. RSVP here <[[http://www.meetup.com/Open-Data-Platform-Group/events/231569465/]]>. Great Reads <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/big-data-pivotal/products/fail-fast-and-ask-more-questions-of-your-data-with-hdb-2-0]]>
If you just can’t wait for the summit to get started, here is some recommended pre-event reading to tide you over:
- Fail Fast and Ask More Questions of Your Data with Pivotal HDB 2.0 <[[https://blog.pivotal.io/big-data-pivotal/products/fail-fast-and-ask-more-questions-of-your-data-with-hdb-2-0]]> - Pivotal and Hortonworks Expand Relationship with HDB SQL-on-Hadoop Reseller Deal <[[http://pivotal.io/big-data/analyst-report/pivotal-and-hortonworks-expand-relationship-with-hdb-sql-on-hadoop-reseller-deal]]> - Pivotal and Hortonworks: Pieces to the Hadoop Puzzle <[[http://pivotal.io/big-data/infographic/pivotal-hortonworks-pieces-to-the-hadoop-puzzle]]> - Introducing the Newly Redesigned Apache HAWQ (incubating) <[[http://pivotal.io/big-data/white-paper/introducing-the-newly-redesigned-apache-hawq]]> - Shaping the Future of Data Warehousing through Open Source Software <[[http://pivotal.io/shaping-the-future-of-data-warehousing-through-open-source-software]]>
We can’t wait to see you at Hadoop Summit 2016 in San Jose; it’s sure to be a fun and informative week!
Sincerely,
The Pivotal Team
